Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Z2 (Synthetic AMPs, Ile-rich, Arg-rich, UCLL1; BBN; Z1, MIC>64 ug/ml)

Literature.Author: Zhang MY, Li S, Han YL, Shi YF, Wu YY, Cheng J, Wang CY, Zhou XY, Zhang YX. 2025
Literature.Title: De novo-designed amphiphilic alpha-helical peptide Z2 exhibits broad-spectrum antimicrobial, anti-biofilm, and anti-inflammatory efficacy in acute Pseudomonas aeruginosa pneumonia.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar to (58.82%) todesigned GNU6I: 47%, R: 35%, K: 12%.Activity: active against 4 strains E. coli ATCC 9637 or SYP-B3820/B4288/B4289 (MIC 2-8 ug/ml), 3 strains A. baumannii SYP-B4290/B4291/B3819 (MIC 4-8 ug/ml), S. paratyphi ATCC 14028 (MIC 4 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae CMCC46117 (MIC 4 ug/ml), and P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC 4 ug/ml).Warning: only Gram- bacteria were tested.Structure: more helical in SDS than in TFE.In vitro toxicity: 0.14% hemolysis at 128 ug/ml, HC50>100 ug/ml, poorly hemo.lytic.Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa, KCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa, MgCl2-insensitive:P. aeruginosa, FeCl3-insensitive:P. aeruginosa, NH4Cl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa, CaCl2-insensitive:P. aeruginosa,   serum-insensitive (50%).Peptide stability:  cleaved by trypsin, cleaved by chymotrypsin.
